titleInfo.title: USA v. Hardenbrook
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL - The Federal Public Defender for the District of Nebraska is appointed to represent the above named defendant in this matter, as to defendant Troy Hardenbrook. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (JAE)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER APPOINTING COUNSEL - The Federal Public Defender for the District of Nebraska is appointed to represent the above named defendant in this matter, as to defendant Troy Hardenbrook. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. (JAE)

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hardenbrook
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 14 Unopposed Motion for Extension of Time to File Pretrial Motions as to Troy Hardenbrook. Pretrial Motion Deadline set for August 17, 2010. The time between July 20 and August 17, 2010 shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. ( MLF, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER granting 14 Unopposed Motion for Extension of Time to File Pretrial Motions as to Troy Hardenbrook. Pretrial Motion Deadline set for August 17, 2010. The time between July 20 and August 17, 2010 shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirement of the Speedy Trial Act. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. ( MLF, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hardenbrook
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 24 Motion to Disclose Identity of Confidential Informant as to the disclosure of the name of the confidential informant as to defendant Troy Hardenbrook. The government is ordered to reveal the name of the confidential informant to the defendant fourteen (14) days prior to defendant's trial date. The motion is overruled as to defendant's request for an evidentiary hearing and oral argument. A party may object to a magistrate judge's order by filing an "Objection to Magistrate Judge's Order" within 14 days after being served with the order. The objecting party must comply with all requirements of NECrimR 59.2. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. ( MLF, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER granting 24 Motion to Disclose Identity of Confidential Informant as to the disclosure of the name of the confidential informant as to defendant Troy Hardenbrook. The government is ordered to reveal the name of the confidential informant to the defendant fourteen (14) days prior to defendant's trial date. The motion is overruled as to defendant's request for an evidentiary hearing and oral argument. A party may object to a magistrate judge's order by filing an "Objection to Magistrate Judge's Order" within 14 days after being served with the order. The objecting party must comply with all requirements of NECrimR 59.2. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F. A. Gossett. ( MLF, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hardenbrook
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER regarding 30 Motion to Dismiss Criminal Case as to Troy Hardenbrook. The government shall file a response to the motion on or before November 8, 2010. The government's response shall include a detailed and itemized calculation of the defendant's speedy trial deadline, covering the time from the filing of the indictment through the filing of the motion to dismiss. For each period of time allegedly excluded, the government shall provide a pinpoint citation to the applicable section of the Speedy Trial Act. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F.A. Gossett. ( MLF, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER regarding 30 Motion to Dismiss Criminal Case as to Troy Hardenbrook. The government shall file a response to the motion on or before November 8, 2010. titleInfo.title: USA v. Hardenbrook
titleInfo.subTitle: FINDINGS AND RECOMMENDATION that MOTION to Dismiss Criminal Case 30 be granted, and that the indictment be dismissed without prejudice; and that MOTION to Set Trial Date29 be denied, as to defendant(s) Troy Hardenbrook. Ordered by Magistrate Judge F.A. Gossett. (CLS, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Hardenbrook
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER that Plaintiff's motion to set trial date 29 is denied. The findings and recommendation of the magistrate judge 34 are approved and adopted. The indictment 1 is dismissed without prejudice as to Troy Hardenbrook (1). Ordered by Senior Judge Lyle E. Strom. (JSF)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
